programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: King Philip launches a massive attack on the Chartres Temple, igniting a battle that will determine the fate of the Knights Templar. Tom Cullen, Ed Stoppard, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney star.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A vampire alligator terrorises Troy's hunting grounds, while RJ hunts with his brother Al for the first time since they were teenagers.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: An over-exuberant buyer leaves a lasting impression at an auction in Brampton. Meanwhile, Roy takes on hired help in the form of an intern.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.sub-title: Honeymoon Capital of the Storage World
programme.desc: The newly married Bogart receives the family book from his dad. Plus, the buyers discover some bizarre finds at an auction in Niagara Falls.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A member of staff races to find a woman's impounded car while her taxi waits outside, and an experienced parking warden shows off her ticket dispensing instincts.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The FV-Tuna.com boat remains in the lead but on the Lisa & Jake, Paul has caught three fish and is on target to reach his $50,000 goal.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The Massachusetts bluefin tuna fishermen return, battling the icy waters of the North Atlantic to land their potentially lucrative catch. The series opener follows the fishermen as they head out to catch the first fish of the season, with captains Tyler McLaughlin and Dave Carraro trying to assert their dominance yet again.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys snap to attention when a client brings in a rare West Point musket. They also get offered pilot licences signed by father of flight Orville Wright.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys are offered a poster signed by Steve McQueen, and examine a diary from the American Civil War - but have a hard time making sense of the writing.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexico's Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The theory that aliens might have told Joan of Arc how to beat the English army, and whether an American serviceman received a message when he touched a spaceship.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Sandy hits America, cavers in California are caught in flash floods, and wild winds cause a hot air balloon crash in Canada.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A vampire alligator terrorises Troy's hunting grounds, while RJ hunts with his brother Al for the first time since they were teenagers.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The heat is on for Bodie as he faces the biggest restoration project of his career.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.desc: Three chefs hit the grills for the barbecue contest, serving up some meaty mains, while in the crossfire round, they really need to beef up their game.

programme.title: Fire Masters: BBQ Wars
programme.sub-title: Sticks and Stones - But Please No Bones!
programme.desc: The judges have a bone to pick with the chefs in the signature round, no stone is left unturned for the crossfire round and the final sees them serving up some New Orleans food.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee shares his experience of running a successful pawn shop with Antwan, and the team values a rare Second World War artefact.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer offers the team a gambling set - complete with concealed weapons - while Chumlee questions the value of a Snoop Dogg doll.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee takes over from Antwaun as the shop's security guard, while the team values a drum from the American Civil War and a motorcycle club uniform.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff put a price on a 1940s mandolin, and try to determine if a signed print of Abraham Lincoln is genuine.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod has trouble letting go of the reins after he and Brandi agree to let Alex and Bozek handle the auctions.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit Torrance for tough competition over only a few quality lockers. Brandi is forced to face her fears when Jarrod gets a locker sure to give her nightmares. Ivy has rarely scored in the area, so he tries a new tactic to change things up. Rene welcomes a pair of new buyers with some not so friendly competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: There's No Business Like Snow Business
programme.desc: The buyers visit Rimforrest, California where they are hit with a snow storm. Plus, Casey attempts to keep Rene focused and Ivy goes on a shopping spree.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave hits the action hard in a Mojave Desert auction, despite his dislike of the area, while Mary struggles through a locker hoping her profits don't go down the toilet.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head for San Diego in hopes of finding some south of the border treasure, and Rene and Casey step up to defend their home turf against Darrell.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene cannot control his excitement over a collector's unit, while Jarrod and Brandi look to hit quick and easy.

programme.title: Forged in Fire Tournament of Champions
programme.desc: Four armourers must forge a Damascus blade out of something familiar - plate armour. Two then are tasked to forge an exotic hybrid of pain and protection - the Hooded Katar.

programme.title: Ozzy & Jack's American Road Trip
programme.desc: It's Ozzy's birthday so Jack pulls a lot of strings to plan the perfect surprise trip for his father.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: New information is revealed, and questions are answered about the mystery of the RMS Republic, her gold cargo, and Martin Bayerle's obsessive quest to recover the bounty.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: The Knights Templar, captured and brought back to Paris, stand trial for King Phillip and Pope Clement's charges of heresy. Princess Isabella's plot to destroy Princess Margaret is revealed, putting Prince Louis' at odds with King Philip and his sister. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Sandy hits America, cavers in California are caught in flash floods, and wild winds cause a hot air balloon crash in Canada.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Milton Jones and Ava Vidal join Dara O Briain and panellists Hugh Dennis, Andy Parsons and Chris Addison for the comedy panel show taking aim at the week's news from July 2012.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Conservative MP Johnny Mercer and comedian Zoe Lyons joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave suggests revamping the calendar and considers the upshot of buying Twitter followers.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Charlie Higson, Sally Phillips, Johnny Vaughan and Ellie Taylor take their seats at the table with Alan to discuss such varied topics as Josh Hartnett and escapes from oil rigs.

programme.title: Alan Davies: As Yet Untitled
programme.desc: Some of the unseen moments, from Matt Lucas destroying a UK clothing brand to what happens when Russell Kane eats too much curry.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: The Hurting
programme.desc: Clip show featuring the voice of Jake Yapp, as home videos reveal the dumbest things attempted by adults, kids and even animals.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef journeys along the Etang de Thau, famous for its oysters and mussels, before mooring his barge in the port of Sete, where Bastille Day is being celebrated. He also rustles up seafood ragout and roast black bream before travelling on to Marseille to tackle the most famous fish dish of all - bouillabaisse.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef's epic journey from the Atlantic to the Mediterranean comes to an end as he takes the final leg of his gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France. Arriving in Marseille, he samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as showing a variety of traditional recipes. He also cooks roast black bream and finds time to send Chalky a postcard.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May head to the countryside where they harness a group of hi-tech tractors and try to cultivate their own source of fuel. Meanwhile, the Lamborghini Murcielago LP640 is put through its paces, and actress Kristin Scott Thomas is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May build their own stretch limousines out of other vehicles and use them to transport celebrities to the Brit Awards. Meanwhile, a Ford Mustang is put through its paces, and actress Billie Piper is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: A look back at the biggest items Mike and Frank ever picked. Picking was easy - getting the behemoths home was the hardest part.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys visit a museum in Louisiana dedicated to Bonnie and Clyde, and examine a roadie's collection of valuable rock memorabilia.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys find a replica spaceship during a picking trip in Louisiana, and Mike employs some new negotiating tactics to get a suitable price.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites boxer Nicola Adams, comedian Frankie Boyle and comedy actress Diane Morgan to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include magicians, losing one's keys and life itself.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by birdwatcher Bill Oddie and comedians Frank Skinner, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican on the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by space scientist Maggie Aderin-Pocock, comedian Phil Wang, actor Jason Watkins and EastEnders star Adam Woodyatt, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall, winner of the 2017 World's Strongest Man contest, tours the USA on a quest to conquer the biggest and best eye-watering food and physical challenges. Eddie lands in Florida Keys to attempt a conch-fritter eating record, do some serious big-game fishing and try what's billed as the best Key Lime Pie on earth.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall squares up to the Mac & Cheese Challenge at Brooklyn's Mac Shack - which weighs in at more than two kilograms and nearly 7,000 calories of pasta, cheese and sauce.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness present an electric cars special, each taking up the challenge of constructing a battery-powered sports car on a budget. Plus, Chris takes the Tesla Model 3 for a spin on the test track. Plus, Danny Boyle and Himesh Patel, director and star of fantasy comedy Yesterday, drop into the studio.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: The naturalist and explorer leads a team on a mission to summit a remote and unclimbed mountain in the Stauning Alps of Greenland, crossing a vast river and skiing across a glacier.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Actor David Tennant takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Conservative MP Johnny Mercer and comedian Zoe Lyons joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Panellists Sue Perkins, Romesh Ranganathan, Bill Bailey and Alan Davies compete, as Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the irreverent quiz show. This time, he visits the menagerie for a look at some animals that start with the letter M. As usual, the host poses questions that are so difficult, points are awarded for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Dara O Briain, Nina Conti and Danny Bhoy
programme.desc: The stand-up comedy show has Dara O Briain warming up the crowd before introducing routines by ventriloquist extraordinaire Nina Conti and the irrepressible Danny Bhoy.

programme.title: Shipwreck Secrets
programme.desc: In 1925 the SS Cotopaxi carrying coal and 32 men vanished. It has since become synonymous with one of the ocean's greatest mysteries - the Bermuda Triangle.

programme.title: Secrets of Britain
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Tower of London
programme.desc: An exploration of British landmarks, beginning with a look at the Tower of London - which has served as a castle, a jail and a place of execution.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The team travels from Dublin to Derry. On the way, Miranda Krestovnikoff visits the only beach race in Europe run under Jockey Club rules at Laytown Races and Alice Roberts finds herself sent to the Irish salt mines. Mark Horton investigates a lost year in the life of the world's first ocean liner, while Neil Oliver meets the Londonderry women who secretly witnessed the surrender of German U-Boats at the end of the Second World War.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: The changing landscape of the coastline from Newcastle to Hull. Neil Oliver explores the ancient coastal home of the Venerable Bede, and goes to Bridlington to learn about the 200-year struggle to design an unsinkable lifeboat. Mark Horton discovers how laser technology could predict coastal erosion, Dick Strawbridge finds out how Middlesbrough's Transporter Bridge put the city on the map, and Miranda Krestovnikoff heads to Bempton Cliffs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A reluctant Brian enters an addiction centre run by monks to treat his alcoholism, but soon becomes bored and looks for a distraction. He finds one when a chance remark leads the team to reopen an investigation into the death of a heroin user nine years previously - and to help reveal the truth, Gerry is sent undercover as a sex addict. Richard Wilson and Fay Ripley guest star.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: Drama based on the last days of cult leader David Koresh, and the 51-day siege between February and April 1993 at a compound belonging to his religious sect. In the first episode, the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, and Firearms (ATF) receives a tip-off of suspicious activity involving weapons taking place among a small religious community led by David Koresh at the Mount Carmel Center, located just outside of Waco, Texas. Starring Taylor Kitsch, Michael Shannon, Melissa Benoist and John Leguizamo.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: ATF agent Jacob Vasquez begins undercover surveillance on the Mount Carmel compound and befriends David Koresh in hope of finding illegal weapons or other activity.

programme.title: Waco
programme.desc: With the ATF siege in motion, assault vehicles storm the Mount Carmel compound and exchange gunfire, which begins a 51-day stand-off.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered amateur detectives work on a garden for an open-air theatre, where Rosemary's cousin is due to perform. However, the production suffers a setback when an actor shoots himself during rehearsal - and the gun is found to have contained live bullets instead of blanks. A member of the cast gets an attack of stage fright, and Laura is obliged to take her place in the play as the duo try to find the culprit. Drama, with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jo Masters and Samantha Nixon continue to hunt for the missing Lesley Palmer - a case given added urgency by the subsequent disappearance of her ex-boyfriend Stewart Jenson. Smithy and Laura Bryant discover the unidentified hospital patient is June's real son, while Terry Perkins and Phil Hunter investigate a sudden death - but soon find they also have a burglary on their hands.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Smithy discovers Gabriel's real name is actually David Kent. Understandably taken aback, he nevertheless prevents June from telling Okaro. Unfortunately Laura also knows the truth, and lacks his resolve. Filled with righteous indignation, she blurts out the entire sorry saga to a shell-shocked Sheelagh - who blunders headlong into danger as she investigates. On the professional front, Terry investigates an attack on his sister-in-law.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: David Kent returns home unexpectedly and catches wife-to-be Sheelagh going through his belongings. Realising time is running out, he resorts to desperate measures and tries to kill the real Gabriel. Later, as a horrified June looks on, he and Smithy settle their differences once and for all - in a life-or-death struggle on the roof of a tower block.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: A young Idris Elba puts in an appearance at the Thrift Infirmary, as Lady Cora's pregnant maid is rushed in with labour pains, causing Robert's reluctant return..

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor comes up against the governors of the East London Hospital when they threaten to take over the Thrift. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's The Man Who Cried
programme.desc: Feature-length period drama about Abel Mason, an ordinary working man whose extramarital affair leads to murder, and prompts him to hit the road with his son in search of a new life. The pair head north and Abel eventually finds employment with a wealthy garage owner. Ciaran Hinds and Kate Buffery star.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah is concerned about the risks involved in Rene's brain operation and refuses to give her consent, while George steps down as the Country Party candidate and attempts to face his demons regarding his strained relationship with his father. Elizabeth comes home from Sydney to attend Georgie's christening and Gino is worried about his vine saplings.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: James's continued absence leaves Olivia distraught on the morning of Georgie's christening. An anxious Sarah is comforted by Dr Fox.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth spots a strange man in Elizabeth's house and becomes convinced he has spent the night there.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth's wealthy acquaintance Mrs Fortescue, whose sister married a baronet, asks her for a lift into town - but things do not go according to plan. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth plans a candlelit supper to impress Emmet with her singing talents, but fate intervenes and the event does not go as expected. Comedy, starring Patricia Routledge, Clive Swift and David Griffin.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Dr Turner is reunited with a couple whose daughter was born without limbs, and takes them to a specialist unit where she can be fitted for prosthetics. However, while the experience helps the girl's mother to realise that she is not alone, it proves traumatic for the father, who blames his wife for his child's condition. Nurse Crane takes charge of Sister Winifred's driving lessons, and Trixie thinks Christopher is hiding something from her.

programme.title: Harrow
programme.desc: Simon's dead body is found by the river, leaving everyone in a state of shock. Harrow is surprised about all the things he did not know about his protege. The investigator also attends the scene of an accidental electrocution, whom it transpires was the last person Simon spoke to last before his death. Ioan Gruffudd stars.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A body found hanging in the children's playground of a recently regenerated model community proves to be that of a member of the local Community Watch scheme. Suspicion falls on the chairman of the organisation Harry Wallace, a founding father who helped clean up the estate for the residents. Reid fights to clear the local hero's name, but her colleagues are not so easily impressed when it emerges he has form for accidentally killing a man. Glasgow-set detective drama, guest starring Phil McKee, with Blythe Duff.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Jack examines a case previously undertaken by a deceased colleague, who was convinced that the alleged suicide of a journalist was a cover-up by the American government. Enlisting the help of a UFO-spotter, the team discovers the reporter witnessed a mysterious air crash near a US Air Force base, and the retired officers try to track down the original personnel to get some answers. Guest starring Mark Williams, Glynis Barber, Michael Brandon and Raquel Cassidy, with Amanda Redman.

programme.title: Captain America: Civil War (2016)
programme.desc: The superhuman soldier is propelled into conflict with his Avengers teammate Iron Man over a system of government control over their actions - a situation made worse when an old friend is accused of being behind a terror attack. As a cunning conspiracy surrounds them all, Captain America finds himself battling former allies, vengeful enemies, and new heroes on the block Black Panther and Spider-Man. Superhero adventure, starring Chris Evans, Robert Downey Jr and Scarlett Johansson.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show hosted by Rylan Clark-Neal in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of 10 giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to £10,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: When Magoo treats Mr Cat to a parachute jump, the two friends land on the top of the AeroFizz. Mr Magoo mistakes it for a desert island!.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Weasel (in an animal costume) for a groundhog being hunted, and confiscates the hunter's gun..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz is at the pool, he wants to start sub-marine hairdressing! But Magoo, thinks he is fishing in a lake, and starts trying to catch Weasel..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike's owner buys him a pair of cute new shoes for his paws. Mike isn't pleased by the new footwear at all and they make some seriously awful squeaking noises.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The raccoons break into the Mikkelsens house again and Mike is easily defeated during a fight against the determined crooks.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean plans a romantic meal with his girlfriend, only to fall asleep while the main course is in the oven. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean is forced to retrieve a tennis ball from the roof of a house across the road, but gets paralysed by vertigo 60ft up and has to rely on a hamster to steer him to safety. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: A mysterious electrical storm downs the Omni-Copter.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Troublesome Treachery of The...
programme.desc: The boys face off against the Toot Fairy while trying to get Mr Krupp fired..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Dave gets a girlfriend who turns out to be an alien. And she turns out to bear a striking similarity to an everyday household item..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Anna is practising for the school cycling test and is good at it. Dave isn't quite as skilled, but with a new bike from his parents he really hopes to pass..

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Michelin-starred chef Lisa Goodwin-Allen on a visit to the Isle of Man during the warm-up week for the famous TT race. James serves up proper biker food - pork burgers with a spicy apple sauce - and picks up some local Manx kippers to make soup. Lisa visits local organic juice producers before James joins TT legend John McGuinness as he and his team prepare for the race, treating the bikers to lamb chops with hispi cabbage and an olive glaze.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Nurse Maggie Simkiss cares for end of life patients and treats their emotional well-being as well as their direct medical needs. To say thank you for her hard work, Alan Titchmarsh and his team of green-fingered experts arrive at her Hull home and help transform the unkempt garden into a grown-up Mediterranean hideaway.

programme.title: Grow Your Own at Home with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Advice on growing fruit and vegetables, with Alan sharing the tips and tricks he uses on his own plot, with his Love Your Garden team members Katie Rushworth, Frances Tophill and David Domoney joining in from their homes. From seriously stylish ways to grow veg anywhere to practical tips on what to plant and where, they show how to get gardens bursting with fruit, salad, herbs and vegetables to supply the table for the year ahead and beyond.

programme.title: Martin Clunes: My Travels and Other Animals
programme.sub-title: The Good, The Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: Martin learns about animal exploitation - the good, the bad and the ugly. The actor visits Sri Lanka, where fishing for manta rays is legal, but a turtle sanctuary offers hope. In Thailand, he learns more about silk production - as well as a more animal-friendly alternative - and on the Australian Friday Island, he is shown the delicate art of growing pearls. Finally, in the Abrolhos islands, Martin learns about the most valuable catch in Australia's waters.

programme.title: Countrywise
programme.desc: Ben Fogle attends the annual Ennerdale Show in the Lake District, where he takes part in some sheep-showing and gets to grips with some Cumbrian wrestling, while Liz Bonnin heads to the River Nith in south-west Scotland for a training day with the river rescue team. Guest reporter Sheila Hancock returns to the quiet corner of the Dorset coast where she first fell in love with the countryside almost 80 years ago.

programme.title: Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family
programme.desc: Anne 'The Governess' Hegerty presents as eight celebrity families take part in this knockout tournament, hoping to win £25,000 for their chosen charity and the coveted title of Britain's Brightest Celebrity Family. The first episode is a battle of the soaps, as Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon (Bethany Platt) and her family take on former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson (Barry Evans) and his clan. Two new rounds have been added to this celebrity spin on the format - including an Observation round featuring cartoon images of Anne that put their memories to the test.

programme.title: Alan Carr's Epic Gameshow
programme.desc: The comedian takes a trip down memory lane as he presents a series of classic TV game shows, which have all been updated with a new final round offering the contestants a chance to win big. The next four weeks will see Alan in charge of The Price Is Right, Take Your Pick, Strike it Lucky and Bullseye. But tonight he steps into the shoes of much-missed funnyman Bruce Forsyth for Play Your Cards Right, which sees four celebrity couples taking a chance on the turn of a single card. The hopefuls are daytime stalwarts Ruth Langsford and Eamonn Holmes, comedian Chris Ramsey and his wife Rosie, presenter Ore Oduba and his wife Portia, and singer-actress Martine McCutcheon and her husband Jack McManus.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win £250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
programme.desc: Scientist Dr Ian Malcolm reluctantly joins a research team on the island where his employer first designed genetically engineered dinosaurs. Meanwhile, a big-game hunter takes the chance to bag the biggest prize of all - a Tyrannosaurus rex. Steven Spielberg's dinosaur adventure sequel, starring Jeff Goldblum, Julianne Moore, Pete Postlethwaite and Richard Attenborough.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Adam Garcia, Carol Decker, Holly Walsh and Rylan Clark-Neal pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
programme.desc: British author Newt Scamander arrives in 1920s New York with a bagful of magical creatures as part of a global study of fantastic beasts, but gets caught up in a conflict when some of the creatures in his care are accidentally released. With a strange dark force terrorising the city, Newt needs to find some allies to help him round-up the beasts, while saving his own skin in the meantime. Harry Potter prequel, starring Eddie Redmayne, Katherine Waterston and Colin Farrell.

programme.title: Die Another Day (2002)
programme.desc: James Bond is suspended from duty after being taken hostage in North Korea, but goes against orders to track down those who betrayed him. During the pursuit of the terrorist he was investigating before his capture, he discovers a connection with a British billionaire who has constructed a devastating orbital weapon. Spy adventure, starring Pierce Brosnan, Halle Berry, Toby Stephens, Judi Dench and John Cleese.

programme.title: Big Guilty Pleasures of The 10s
programme.desc: Cheesey or amazing?! The 2010's have been a decade of great hits and some you absolutely hate to love.

programme.title: Pink: Raise Your Glass to 20!

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Tunnel Rats get the lifeline they desperately need. Meanwhile, veteran prospector Col Duff prepares for a week-long opal hunt far from civilisation.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: The pair reckon joining forces with a gang of traditional miners will help them strike gold, but as they get deeper into debt, relations with their mining partners become strained.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson heads to California to investigate a network for major fault lines that could set off a mega-quake. Plus, he explores a mysterious sinkhole.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.sub-title: Space Shuttle Tribute Bike - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team visits the Johnson Space Centre as part of preparations for building a Nasa-themed bike as a memorial to two crews who died in space.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: Delving into the distinguished service records of some of the most amazing airlifters flying today, focussing on American transporters.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe travels to the middle of Connecticut to clean out a lake, then visits a gourd farm in Pennsylvania.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew visits the birthplace of the Lotus Evora, revealing its inner workings and admiring its attractive design.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The Bentley Mulsanne, which was first produced in 1980. The crew heads to its birthplace, revealing the inner workings and gorgeous exterior.

programme.title: Outback Pilots
programme.desc: Repa calls in reinforcements in a dog fight with the weather to complete the mission. Meanwhile, police pilot Rob faces a deadly traffic jam on the beat at 12,000ft. Documentary outlining the work of pilots who risk their lives every day flying through Australia's inhospitable Outback terrain.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are scolded when they arrive late for an appointment with Dr Fred. However, once they get past his grumpy assistant, they find themselves in a strange world filled with all kinds of weird and wonderful things.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Ant Anstead drag a rare 1972 Datsun 510 2-door into the 21st century. The engine is in good order, but the bad paint job, gearbox and bodywork let it down.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole gives Simon O'Brien a motorcycling masterclass in Wiltshire as the duo seek more items to fix up and sell on to make profits for their owners.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit the Cotswolds and Somerset, where finds include a set of milk churns and an old munitions shell.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team takes on an antique plate camera, a dilapidated piece of designer furniture and a violin that spent the Second World War in Auschwitz concentration camp.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Metal worker Dominic Chinea has to use all of his restoration skills to future proof an old, Cornish museum sign, while Steven Fletcher has to steer an old banger back onto the road. Plus, bear-care team Julie and Amanda start treatment on George, a very special teddy who has lost one of his eyes and his growl.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A barometer, rowing oars that could have a hidden past and a pinball machine that has spent the last few years being used as a kitchen worktop are restored.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The team restores a broken hand mirror containing the portrait of a mysterious French lady, and a painting of fog on the river Thames is also repaired.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard finds a mysterious piece of black pottery in Lancashire, locates an exotic piece in a zoo in East Anglia and fiercely haggles with an old foe in a salvage yard.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a country house sale in Norfolk, and in Glasgow finds a unique tartan piece at a classic tailor's. Plus, he finds his oddest buy ever in Liverpool.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Part two of two. The team's epic four-year-long wrestling match with the 1961 International Harvester Metro concludes with an incredible, one-of-a-kind van.

programme.title: Plane Reclaimers
programme.desc: In an unassuming corner of Wales lies one of the world's busiest yards for aircraft end-of-life services - home to dozens of these retired relics of the sky. With exclusive access to the day-to-day running of this bustling base, this series monitors the work of those who dismantle and breathe new life into these mammoth machines. Here, the team members are faced with a tight deadline as they prepare to dismantle a highly anticipated Airbus A319 coming in from Abu Dhabi.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are scolded when they arrive late for an appointment with Dr Fred. However, once they get past his grumpy assistant, they find themselves in a strange world filled with all kinds of weird and wonderful things.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard travels the length and breadth of the UK in search of weird and wonderful objects. The bigger the hoard, the happier he is.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Blacksmith conservator Matthew Boultwood takes on a piece of British military history - a ceremonial helmet from one of the oldest regiments in the army, the Life Guards. Jay Blades and the team also restore a miniature chest full of hidden treasure and an extremely rare Victorian clockwork rabbit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: Nasa's Unexplained Files
programme.desc: After Nasa's New Horizons spacecraft flies by Pluto, it encounters a mysterious object that shuts down the probe's computers. Experts investigate what it could be.

programme.title: Kid Criminals
programme.desc: Part two of two. In an effort to reduce the number of children in prison, some US states are trying a revolutionary new approach, with shorter sentences and an emphasis on rehabilitation and treatment programmes. Jason-Caleb Hill was caught breaking into an apartment and stealing a gun. He could be freed within six months if he completes his course. Amanda Artyamsoal was involved in a fatal arson attack that made national headlines. She hopes to be free by her 18th birthday in less than four weeks' time. Cyleina Briggs is spending some of her 10-year sentence at Madison Institutional Facility for girls, rather than an adult prison, while Nathaniel Johnson, 15, has taken 18 months to finish his course - three times longer than most inmates.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Gathering evidence from ashes and rubble to help forensics teams apprehend the perpetrators in cases of arson.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2012, young entrepreneur Terry Porter was found dead by his neighbour. There was no forensic evidence or witnesses, but surveillance footage was relied on for answers.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of Alabama church woman Dorothy Leatherwood. Rumours in the neighbourhood saw detectives struggle to separate fact from fiction.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate a spate of armed robberies across the US in which several people were killed by two male suspects.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigator Deborah Turner conducts proceedings as her team of experts tries to rescue a litter of puppies trapped in a church drain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown looks after Lulu, a sneezing Labradoodle, while Dr Lisa Chimes strives to a save a dog that has been bitten by an infected tick.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Devon visits Kleinfeld's with her fiance, NFL star Duane Brown, while Taya comes in with former American football player Adam Koets.
